com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers
Class TextWriter

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.AbstractWriter
      com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.TextWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Writer
public class TextWriter
extends AbstractWriter

A writer that wraps another writer and writes strings to it.

By default, a text writer does not flush write operations to the underlying writer. It's possible to do so by setting the writer to auto-flush by using the appropriate constructor.

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: Writer
Removes all objects that have been written to this writer since the last time it was flushed. Not all writers support this operation.

Specified by:
clear in interface Writer
Overrides:
clear in class AbstractWriter

flush

public void flush()
           throws WriterException
Description copied from interface: Writer
Flushes everything that has been written to this writer. If there's nothing to flush, nothing will happen. If this writer wraps another writer, the underlying writer will be flushed as well.

Specified by:
flush in interface Writer
Overrides:
flush in class AbstractWriter
Throws:
WriterException - when this writer is closed or when something goes wrong while flushing

close

public void close()
           throws WriterException
Description copied from interface: Writer
Flushes and closes this writer. If this writer wraps another writer, that writer will be closed as well.

After a writer has been closed, it can no longer be used.

Specified by:
close in interface Writer
Overrides:
close in class AbstractWriter
Throws:
WriterException - when this writer can't be closed or has already been closed
